main event: On December 30, 1955, in Gassoway, W. Virginia, an Air Force Officer reported a sighting of four small yellow-white objects, the largest measuring approximately 1/2 the size of a dime, visually for one minute.
interesting points: The observation was reported by an Air Force Officer, adding credibility to the report.
The sighting took place over the course of one minute, providing a relatively long duration for observation.
The objects were described as small yellow-white and visually observed, indicating a detailed and clear sighting.
The report mentions that there were no photographs present, which could have provided visual evidence of the sighting.

Despite the initial assumption of the objects being aircraft due to strong maneuvers observed, the reliability of the observer led to classification as 'unknown' pending further information and developments.
